And into more of the lightly angry corrective tone. But now he's into making his case. He's cleared up some mistruths, some gossip that has been spoken. He's put the data, the timeline back in front of this church in Galatia to be like, Hey, guys, some people came into your church and tried to cause problems here. And you fell for it. But if you really actually think about the facts, both of our relationship and of what God has done in your life and of the Bible and of logic, you'll see these people are fully crap and they're just making stuff up. Then causing problems for no reason. And you will be able to figure out that you should ignore them and why you should ignore them. So we're past the part where Paul is hitting them with the shock and awe campaign of like, Yeah, you guys are. I can't believe how quickly you got this wrong. What is the matter with you? You're wrong about all these things. We're past that. And now we're into the part where he in a fatherly way is giving them language that they can use internally in their own brains amongst themselves as a congregation and externally to defeat these. Bad ideas and not just to move forward believing in the true gospel message because Paul said so, but believing in it because they actually believe it and they've actually thought it through. And you and I are the beneficiaries of this process because this letter is timeless.
